definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: Illustrated diagrams of animal anatomy including bones and muscles.
sentences.chinese: 畫報動物解剖圖，包括骨骼和肌肉。

sentences.english: This thesis is intended to analyze the artistic style of the Dianshizhai Pictorial, and how it get this style.
sentences.chinese: 本文旨在分析《點石齋畫報》的藝術風格及其成因。

sentences.english: We have some magazines and pictorials in English.
sentences.chinese: 我們有英文的雜誌和畫報。

sentences.english: The first number of the pictorial leaped straight to success.
sentences.chinese: 畫報的創刊號一舉成功。

sentences.english: I've finished with these pictorials . You can take them away.
sentences.chinese: 這些畫報我都看過了，你把它拿去吧。

sentences.english: Mary Lou was named sportswoman of the year by Sports Illustrated.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗婁被任命爲運動員的年度體育畫報。

sentences.english: She became known after appearing on the cover of the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue.
sentences.chinese: 她真正走紅是在登上《體育畫報》的泳裝專刊之後。

definition: the Shanghai of old, with its foreign settlements/(fig.) a bustling, cosmopolitan city
chief editor (of newspaper)/abbr. for 總編輯|总编辑
